clinical_study.brief_title: Asymptomatic Primary Hyperparathyroidism: A Prospective, Randomized Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Asymptomatic Primary Hyperparathyroidism: A Prospective, Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The present study is a randomized, controlled trial that investigates the effects of parathyroidectomy or medical observation in mild asymptomatic pHPT on morbidity and quality of life (QoL).

detailed_description.textblock:
The patients are included and randomized by block randomization to medical observation or parathyroidectomy by an experienced parathyroid surgeon.
The patients will be followed up for 10 years.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Untreated, asymptomatic pHPT
- 2.60>S-Ca<2.85 mmol/liter
- Age between 50 and 80 yr
- No medications interfering with Ca-metabolism
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hyperparathyroid bone disease
- Previous operation in the neck
- Impaired kidney function
- Kidney stones
- Complicating medical conditions
- Psychiatric disorders
- Multiple endocrine neoplasia,
- Familial hypocalcuric hypercalcemia
- Familial HPT
